abstract: Ohio State quarterbacks Cardale Jones and J T Barrett are battling for team's No. 1 spot this season; Jones went from third-stringer to starter after Barrett suffered season-ending shoulder injury in past season; Buckeyes, led by Jones, went on to win national championship.
lead_paragraph: Cardale Jones, who went from third-stringer to starting quarterback as Ohio State won the national championship, finds himself in a duel with J. T. Barrett, a Heisman Trophy contender last season.

headline.main: Ohio State’s Quarterback Plan Still Unclear Months After National Title
headline.print_headline: Buckeyes’ Next Battle for No. 1 Is Between Two Quarterbacks

snippet: Cardale Jones, who went from third-stringer to starting quarterback as Ohio State won the national championship, finds himself in a duel with J. T. Barrett, a Heisman Trophy contender last season.
